Everything went fine ... .They switched my front wheels with the back ones and did not ( believe me ! ! ! ) align the car after that ... . Obviously the car just did n't go strait anymore ... I tried to take tha car back to the shop in order for them to fix this issue , but as I live in a small town , they were closed during the weekend . So I decided I would do it myself . I used this impact driver to remove one of the wheels , replace it with the spare , remove the other wheel , change them ... I did it with all the four wheels and the battery did n't even seem to discharge ... .So , if you want a good but compact lightweight impact driver , that would be my choice .

I should preface this review by saying I 'm not a professional construction worker , just a week-end tinkerer who does projects around the house and yard . I previously owned a Makita cordless drill and I do n't have much good to say about it -- nothing worse than a 20 minute expedition through the crawlspace to find out that your battery is dying on the job.Nothing like that with the amazing 3.0 Ah battery on this puppy . Lots of torque , and the longest run time I 've ever seen in a cordless power tool . Charging takes an hour or two . Since I do n't use it that often , I really appreciate that the battery does n't discharge when not in use -- although since it 's a Li-Ion it should not be stored fully charged for an extended period of time . Another benefit : it 's very lightweight for the amount of power it stores , especially compared to those old nicad batteries.Highly recommended ; this is a quality tool .

A compact , balanced extremely powerful tool . The three lights are bright , reverse button on the head , comfortable traction grip . The size/power is what 's really astounding . The head of the drill is the same length as the battery and weighted/balanced perfectly ( picture is accurate portrayal of size ) . DeWALT continues to provide excellence in the quality products offered to it 's consumers and this latest addition is no exception . My father in law had major tool envy when I showed it to him , he owns a custom drapery business and each week will have to go and install something himself for one reason or another , and currently uses a DeWALT drill and an electric impact driver . There was nothing that he did not like about this tool . Actually he LOVED it ! Blown away by it 's power , particularly liked the heavy duty belt clip , the 20v ( his drill is less ) and balance /size . Something that we can both agree on for a change !

Its seems to be getting harder and harder in finding dependable tools that can hold their own . That is especially true with drills . Like any other guy , I jumped at the opportunity to take the DeWalt DCF885L2 20V Impact Driver for a test drive . After a little over three months use , these are my thoughts.Like other same brand tools that I own , DeWalt battery packs have an initial one to two hour charge . The batteries that came with this driver were ready to go to work . Weighing in at 3.4 lbs , and measuring almost 6 '' front to back , this driver is compact and easily held its own in even the tightest of spaces . Ergonomically , its a tool that 's hard to put down . No more shadowing or poor visibility because this driver is outfitted with ( 3 ) LED lights with a 20 second delay after I release the trigger . The single handed loading feature is sweet . The 1/4 '' hex chuck accepts 1 '' bit tips . The attached belt clip is sturdy and has come in handy on more then one occasion.Juiced with a surprisingly powerful 20V MAX lithium battery pack , its full throttle from the start to finish . At 3200ipm ( Impact Per Minute ) its no light weight . The no load speed comes in at 2800rpm . With this tool it takes practically no time for me to assemble or break down displays and rigging . When charging , the light on the charger will blink on and off during the process . The light will stay illuminated when charging is complete . Unlike other brands , it does n't hurt to leave your battery in the charger.The DeWalt DCF885L2 20V Driver comes packed with ( 2 ) 20V Max lithium Ion 3.0 Ah Battery packs , charger , and a storage case . The manufacturer tacks on a three year limited warranty and a one year free service contract . The company also adds a 90 day money back guarantee . The only thing that it does n't come with is bit tips.Overall , I 'm very impressed with this DeWalt 20V Driver . Without a doubt , its a quality tool built for durability and endurance . I know for me personally , its been a workhorse .

I 've been using this tool at work ( automotive ) for a year . This means daily constant use often at it 's limit . Which is a very generous limit . It 's been borrowed by others and found to be indispensable . Even if it does not tighten large hardware ( lugnuts , motor mounts , etc . ) to spec it does a wonderful job of running it up . And it 's loosening power , along with a bit of heat and penetrating oil , has saved many a snapped bolt or stud from happening . ( impacts do n't apply accumulated force like a pull on a long breaker bar will ) The variable speed trigger allows it to be used with the small hardware as well . Unfortunately I 'm here to buy a replacement , but only because I misplaced it . So this is ... its eulogy as well as a review .

This is the first 20v driver I 've come across and the first Dewalt product I 've owned . I 'm happy to say I 've been blown away by it 's power and performance.The battery charged quickly and has been holding power for much longer than I ever anticipated.There is a very handy light that remains lit for about 30 seconds after you press it . Very helpful in small dark areas.The only two things I 've missed that my last driver had : a built in level and a magnetic pad to hold bits . Those are very minor things considering how well the drill performs overall .

Well I received my Dewalt 20v Impact Drill , `` Amazon style '' fast delivery very well packaged and in great condition , batteries were already charged , so I unpacked it and started using it the very next day , for some reason I feel like the batteries are not lasting more than my Makita set ... I have n't had time to do a side by side comparison , but I 'm planing to do it , I needed to frame a pocket door and it was required that I do it with screws which I did not use that many , then for sheets of sheet rock the following day and I ran out on the first battery ... .. and then the same thing with the second battery ... .so I do n't feel that the 35 % more running power is happening ... ..I will however run a test on Sunday , with a fully charged battery ... ..and see how many screws I can drive with one charge.I have to say that I like this Dewalt Imapct , the size , the weight , the power , the fast 30 minute charger , the 3 LED lights are great , [ my co workers are jealous ] ... ... ... I will update this first review later on.Update : I was able to drive 140 3 inch screws into a double 2x6 boards with one charge , screws were driven 1 right next to each other.I took some pictures but I do n't see a way to insert them here . I 'll take a video tomorrow 10/05/2011Update 2 : After exactly 88 days my drill already started wobbling to the point that is very difficult to drive screws : ( I 'm disappointed , I 'll see what Dewalt can do . Amazon does not allowed for me to return it for the 90 day Dewalt return policy . : ( I like my impact but I 'm disappointed its wobbling after just 88 days.I take good car of my tools specially on the trial period , it was not drop or abused so that 's why I 'm disappointed , specially when it supposed to be a workhorse ... ... ... did I 'm mentioned I 'm disappointed ? : )

This review is for the drill . I really like it . Compact and very powerful.You can operate the bit chuck with one hand . The light is helpful and stays on some seconds after releasing the trigger . Drilling in steel and pressing hard unable to slow the drill . I purchased the 3 AH battery and a dead battery should not be a problem . I like the feel of this drill in your hand - it just feels right ! I like the two speed transmission . Having just purchased this drill , still getting to know it - will follow up in a month or two .

This electric drill and impact driver set is very high quality , easy to use , and quite convenient due to the battery operation . On the other hand , it is rather heavy , and since the drill can function as an impact driver this paired set may be more suitable for those who need to use an impact driver frequently.Pro : Nice carrying and storage case . The two tools and the battery charger fit in securely.Both tools are very comfortable in the hand.The drill has good capabilities ; two speeds , and the ability to vary the torque by means of a ring around the barrel ( though they recommend that one checks the actual torque with a specific wrench , rather than rely on the settings ) . It is reversible . This is by far the best drill I have ever used.It is easy to put bits into the drill , without a chuck . I like the extra drill bit holder in the handle . There is a snap connector for the impact driver that takes 1/4 inch hex bits.Convenient belt clip on both tools ( although with the weight I 'd suggest a VERY snug belt ) .The impact driver has a nice three LED light that illuminates the work space ; the drill provides a single LED which still manages to do a good job in dim environments.The impact driver is very small and will work well in a constricted space.Two batteries are provided , so if one is only using a single item , a spare battery is ready.Con : Weight . These two are heavy , due to the batteries . One pays for the convenience of not having that power cord.Summary : Very good products , highly recommended . I 'm not sure that the impact driver will be as useful to the average user as the drill . If you need both , this is a great set . Otherwise , you may want to opt for just the drill .

I 'm really happy with these tools . The impact driver has plenty of power . The charge last long enough for my needs . With the extra battery and fast charge it 's not a problem . If I needed these for daily use like a carpenter would . I probably would have needed the 3.0 Ah Batteries . The drill works good and it 's easy to change bits .

I had no idea what the little impact driver would do , but on my first project , it was more useful than the drill . Also , the 18 -20 power is far better than my old 12 V DeWalt drill . The drill has enough power to drive a 3 & # 34 ; hole saw thru about 6 & # 34 ; of sill beam . I hesitated to give the unit 5 stars because the drill has a problem with drill bits smaller than 3/16 & # 34 ; .. The bit comes loose when it gets stuck in sheetmetal holes , , I do n't do sheetmetal much so am not too concerned . I assume this is because the chuck goes up to 1/2 & # 34 ; and is n't & # 34 ; fine & # 34 ; enough to handle the small bits.Two drills allows me to predrill a hole with the drill and then drive a screw etc with the inpact driver if necessary . The driver is powerful enough , however , to drive the screw with out the pilot hole in most cases .
This is a great drill and driver set . The battery is always ready with power to spare . I can leave it for a month and go to use it and the battery performs .

I 've owned several cordless kits/tools over the last couple of decades . My needs have changed as I 've grown in projects , and my old cheap black and decker sets have long since been replaced by Dewalts . I 've had the Dewalt 18V kits for several years and I 've been very happy with them . They last through most small jobs with one charge . They are solid , beefy , and have plenty of power , but are also pretty heavy . I nearly converted over to the Li-ion packs , but the price always kept me from it . Then came the 12v max line , I thought they were perfect for nearly every small job and home use . They are light , solid , and have surprising power in a compact size . The charge they hold may not last the entire project , but the packs are so cheap you can buy a couple extra to finish up ( and not break your wallet ) .Well now we have the 20v Max line . To be honest , if I did n't need to buy some new 18v packs , I would n't have even considered getting these . But I did , and I 'm not disappointed . They all have the same solid , beefy Dewalt design , but now they are light and compact as well . They appear to be nearly as small/compact as the 12v max tools . And these tools hold a charge for much longer than their 12v cousins . ( Sorry , I have n't done a comparison test on how long they all last , 12 vs 18 vs 20 ) .The new Impact driver is equal to the 18v version but lighter . Function and size seem nearly the same , but the 20v is slightly smaller and a good bit lighter.The new compact drill is not as small as the 12v version , but is slightly smaller than the 18v compact . power/speed seem to be equal to the 18v and better than the 12v , as you would expect.Charging seems much faster ( about 30min or so , but do n't hold me to it as I did n't discharge the pack fully ) .Even the case is great , since I 'm always using the impact and drill they go with me everywhere and take the most abuse , the hard case is a welcome change , than the soft bags of before.In summary , I 'd recommend this set if you are new or moving up from the inexpensive ( and usually low quality ) brands . If you 're already heavy into the old 18v stuff , I would n't bother with a switch until you have to replace them . In all fairness , I have not had much experience with other brands kits ( some Milwaulkee , a Bosch , and a Makita ) I 'm sure they are all great sets , but I was already using Dewalt so I stuck with them .

Let me start by saying I 'm no professional . I like to dabble in furniture and DIY projects around the house . My last drill was the Makita combo kit that retailed for 199 . I really liked the drill but the battery did n't hold very long and in the end the chuck went bad . At least that is what I was told it was . It would just spin out after drilling 2 screws into anything . That was after less than 6 months of normal to easy use . I ended up going with Dewalt this time around due mostly because I 've heard such good things about their stuff holding up . I want something I do n't have to replace every year ! The first unit I got did have a noticeable wobble and I returned it for another one . This one had a slight one but nothing more than anything else I 've ever used . I notice quite a bit more power in the impact drill over the makita right from the start . It just feels more powerful.I also like the fact that it goes to 2000 rpm , which is what is stated on the kreg jig site as a recommendation for drills . So if you use a Kreg Jig make sure you get one that will work best.Battery charges just as fast as my Makita did , without the horrible sounds that the Makita made while charging . It really was like the xbox of chargers . I could n't stand being in the same room as it charged up . The Dewalt is quiet and I do n't even hear a sound.One thing I have noticed on both the Dewalts was a bit of a smell coming off when first using them . I guess this is normal for a new drill , or you can correct me if I 'm wrong ... It is n't overpowering or any smoke . Just a faint smell of burn off of dust or something like that.Overall I 'm loving the drill . This is one of the rare times when I suggest going to Blue or Orange to buy the drill . It is WAY cheaper right now that way . Kinda sad really but Amazon is n't selling the item so it is up to whoever is on the price . Ca n't really fault Amazon on that one . Just do n't give your hard earned money away when you can save 50 bucks . Great thing is if it does wobble you can return it right away and get another one locally without waiting for returns and shipments.I looked at all the drills in the price range and for my money I was happy to land with Dewalt this time around .

As a contractor , I can say I 've owned my share of power tools ; this set blows everything else I 've owned out of the water . Upgrading my 10 year old 18V Dewalt cordless drill to this was like an awakening . Why did I tote around that large , heavy , slow-charging drill all these years ? The compact size does NOT mean less power ; the smaller battery does NOT mean less battery life ; this is simply the `` new '' and `` improved '' drill we 've all been waiting for . I bought the set for the impact driver , but if you do n't need it , I would still highly recommend the drill .

I purchased this set for light-moderate home usage . So far I have been very pleased by the set.First , the case . There is ample space for the tools and some room left over for some bits as well . Do n't plan on fitting a box of drill bits ... but you can certainly store some loose bits and small tools . The case handle is nicely contoured for carrying and feels good to hold . This is just the beginning.The charger is pretty compact . It would be nice to have some information regarding the battery level or status ... as this charger just has the same old blinking light ... However , the battery charges quickly , so you will not have to wait long . In my experience , the charger did not get too warm either.I have used the drill far more than the impact driver so far , so I will focus my comments on the drill.This drill is light . Upgrading the 1.5mAh battery to a 3mAh size will surely add some weight , but really not much . Drill bits load and unload quickly , with a satisfying click in the chuck when loading bits . The exterior of the drill is all plastic construction with a rubber grip . Metal would be nice , but for a household user the lighter weight is more appreciated . That said , the construction is very solid . Both tools have a belt hook on the side , which should really be a standard feature on any drill . Because of the light weight , hanging this drill on your belt wo n't drag you down.My gripe with the drill is that the LED worklight ( located near the trigger ) is almost useless at close range . The light becomes shadowed very very quickly by the long snout of the drill . The impact driver , on the other hand , has three LEDs located all around the drill bit ... . which makes for full light coverage even at close range.Both tools have a lot of torque and plenty of power.At the current price of $ 199 ... this is a great set . I was happy with my purchase when this combo was at $ 240 , and I would highly recommend it .

The Dewalt tools I 've used over the past many years have always been great.And now Dewalt has improved their style of battery releaseon this 20 volt combo , and it 's awesome.The forward/reverse button is at thumbs reach , and the drill is more petite all-around.It 's pretty impressive that this set is much more powerful , and yet so much smaller and lighter.This 1 1/2 ah version is very easy , and conveient to use.It has a strong metel hook to hang from a belt , which would actually be useful in any number of ways.The bit slot is open ended , so it no longer limits the lenght of bit it 'll hold.When you press the trigger of the drill , one LED light shines on where your pointed , and goes off automatically 20 seconds after the trigger is released.The impact driver does the same & has three LED lights.The lithium ion battery charges much quicker then my old nickel , taking only 15 to 30 min . depending how low the battery is.This Combo kit comes in a nice , but rugged hard plastic case.That 's great for storage or travel.This petite combo was designed with reliable powerfor working in tight areas , without tiring your hand as quickly.Footnote : Dewalt makes a quick connect impact driver conversion keyless chuck , Dewalt DW0521 . This chuck fits inside the impact driver chuck so it will hold drill bits .

These are a great set . The battery lasts longer than expected every time . The impact is strong for only a quarter inch . Most times I do n't have to tighted things after its used . The light is handy .

i have had every cordless tool made and these dewalts are nice . they are very light to work with but definately pack a punch . both the impact and the drill have a lot of power . there was a special going on at the time with a free third battery and that was nice . i have used them for several months now and they are holding up well .

This is a great set to have IF you are going to get use out of both the Compact Drill AND the Impact Driver , otherwise it would be less expensive to just buy the one you will use . My husband loves it and is using it for work as well as in his workshop . I have used the drill for household projects , but it 's a bit heavy for me . I am more comfortable using a lighter drill.The DEWALT Combo Kit is a quality item that I would highly recommend because we have other DEWALT tools and have never had a problem with any of them , making them very dependable . It 's also nice to not have to worry about charging the battery before every use .

I received this toolset as part of the Amazon Vine program , and boy , has it already come in handy . We have an existing 18V Black and Decker drill and Dewalt drill , so this was a bit of an upgrade.We tore out the rotten part of the bottom deck from the last owners and discovered significant decay on one of the structure poles . Unfortunately , it was bolted into the concrete . I thought we were sunk - then this toolset arrived and we were able to reseat a fresh pole ! This little set worked great through the concrete . I used these tools about 6 hours over 4 days and did not run out of battery.I noticed some earlier reviewers complaining about wobble and travel . I did not have that problem with my set - so it might be that the quality control problem has been fixed ? The radio is ok - but it seems like an odd combo with this set . Most people already have existing radios . The one nice thing is that it does have a USB connection so you could charge something like a phone or a tablet ( or , if you are like me , review a how-to video again ! ) Overall , a great toolset that is relatively light , powerful , and currently a good value at $ 280 .

This DeWalt drill set is fantastic . It comes with both a hammer drill and a compact drill . Furthermore , the set comes with two 20-volt batteries and a charging unit . So far , I like everything about it . The two batteries are more than enough to keep you in action full time . It takes very little time to achieve a full charge . In my tests , it is less than 30 minutes to complete the charge . The batteries themselves run for 1.5 hours of general use . At that rate , you can keep switching the batteries out , and keep on going in your job . The drills are POWERFUL ! Even the compact drill , which is great for getting into tight spaces , gives a tremendous amount of torque and speed , making tough drilling tasks much easier . The hammer drill is also very good . I could have used this last year when I was driving some wood beams into a concrete foundation to support a small stairway . One negative - while the hammer drill is powerful , it does not come with a support grip for your other hand to achieve maximum pressure while applying the hammer drill to its task . Despite that issue , the set is fantastic . I highly recommend it for your toughest household jobs .

This 20VDC hammer drill is compact and easy to fit into tight places , but do n't let the small size fool you -- it 's a powerful tool . I was able to easily bore through a 2 & # 34 ; X 4 & # 34 ; wall stud , using a 1 & # 34 ; auger bit , without the bit even slowing down .

I have seen other reviews talking about issues with drill wobble but I have seen none of this . I 'm not sure if it 's an issue from a past production run that has now been corrected or what but that issue does not exist on mine . I am not a professional installed of anything . I am a home owner who likes to do a variety of home projects . Previously I had a DeWalt 14.4v drill which these replaced . The 14.4v I had was solid as a rock but these 20v max drill/drivers are actually better . Last longer , more comfortable in my hand , have led lights which are a huge plus . These are high quality tools as you would expect from DeWalt and it shows . I have dropped them a few times and it 's like they are bullet proof , not a scratch . Talk about power , these are super powerful and noticably more powerful than my buddies bosch and panasonic drills . I have yet to find anything they ca n't handle . I like the fact that they all use the same 20v battery too . Charging is pretty quick and they hold a charge for a long time . Love the belt hooks as it 's really convenient . Overall if you are in the market for a new drill I would highly recommend spending a little more and getting this kit . For the price you ca n't beat it .

Had them for a week now and used both . They are very powerful , light and quality constructed . I 've never owned an impact driver before this one and I believe I 've found a new best friend . Highly recommended .

POWER POWER POWER.The new lithium ion batteries are VERY light . Plus , the drill itself is light , making long projects far less fatiguing than with older drills . 2 batteries are included . 30-35 minutes for a full charge and the batteries last a long time . Nonstop drilling action if you need/want it.The super powerful drill really is amazing . The lighted tip was a brilliant addition . It really makes it nice when drilling in a dark space or even just a place without great light ; you can see exactly what you are drilling . The light is on a timer , so it lights for a while and then shuts itself off . The batteries are interchangeable and charge surprisingly rapidly . By the time one wears out , the other one is ready to go . But do n't get me wrong , the batteries LAST quite a while.I ca n't recommend this highly enough . After using it for a couple of projects , it is clear that the lithium battery with its added power but super light weight is a HUGE advancement . Dewalt has got this DOWN ! Yes yes yes for the professional or do-it-yourself guy . Light enough even a small woman would n't struggle with it ... not to insult anyone 's masculinity . Good price and obviously the work of Dewalt incorporating feedback from their customers .

Dewalt is a well-known name for tools so the positive performance was no surprise . I like my Dewalt power toots and these just add to the garage fun.What is different about this is that the carry case is basically a kit -- You get an impact driver ( 20v ) , you get a compact hammer drill ( 20 v ) AND it also houses a workplace radioYou charge them with the lithium charger for the battery.A lover of my MP3 , I was not actually sure how I 'd feel about the radio or if I would use it ( even though I found the tools in the kit very easy to use ( I recently helped someone I hired build on to a chicken coop . Team effort . ) but I was delightfully surprised at the clarity and I actually enjoyed the music and chatter while we worked . Not having to plug it in was an even greater bonus.Very lightweight but with loads of power , these were easy to use and I am a novice with these tools.Charging was a snap , it 's all in a nice case , and everything is easy to use , novice or pro .

Dewalt is a respected name in the power tool business . These are heavy duty tools with 20 volts . Dewalt advertises that compared to 18 volt tools these have 37 % longer runtime per charge and are 57 % faster.The first thing we noticed was the LED lights which illuminate your work surface , brilliant . The power tools can be used on any surface including masonry . My husband feels they fit his hand nicely and are comfortable to grip.My husband is thrilled to have these tools to use for small home repair tasks.The radio is nice , gets great reception here and is loud and high quality . He wants to also use it for patio and poolside use ! There is a USB port to charge your phone , really convenient for workers.We rate this 5 stars = Love It !

These tools feel solid . I have used them for a few days now on a few small things and I have felt I had enough power to keep on going . I fixed a fence that has been giving me issues for several years . My old drill just didnt get the speed going to sink the screws into the wood and it always left the nails hanging a little out . This thing took all of 30 seconds to fix something I couldnt in two years . The radio is pretty nice , solid feeling as well and it has several outs on it where you can charge things . You can play the radio with it and you can also use it for an auxiliary and use it for whatever you want . I havent gotten a chance to properly use the impact wrench yet but can say it is insane when it is turned on and feels awesome in your hand . I will test it out this week on something and continue my review . All in all I can say these are some of the nicest tools I have used in a long time .

DeWalt is the cream of the crop , and everyone already knows that , so if you 've made it to this page , chances are you already know this is what you 're looking for . The tools are amazing quality . Only thing I can really add is that the radio is better than I expected . Not only can you connect an iPod , but you can also charge it . I do wish this kit had included another battery , but it 's a pretty good deal as-is , so I ca n't knock it a star for that . Overall , highly recommended to anyone that needs a hammer drill and impact driver ! !
Great set of power drills . Compact and powerful . Fits in hand and comfortable . Awesome set . Can not think of anything bad about it .

I love the lithium tools compared to previous Ni-Cad tools . The lithium batteries hold a charge and are ready to go when you need them . Ni-Cads always seem to be dead and they take a memory and fail much sooner than I 've experienced with Lithium batteries . This set includes the smallest batteries Dewalt makes for the 20V Max line , but higher capacity batteries are readily available . The drill and impact driver run very smoothly , and have a precision feel . I love the radio . It has some great features like a USB port and audio line in ability so you can stream or play songs from an MP3 player . It ran 10 hours or so on one battery charge , but it can also be plugged in . I do n't see the radio in other sets sold by other vendors , so I considered it a nice bonus with this set . The bag is also a convenient way to transport the tools to where the job is . I found the batteries charge very quickly , and the manual says they wo n't take a memory and can be charged at any time without degrading performance . Also , batteries can be left on the charger without risk of over-charging according to the manual . That is a nice feature if you forget to remove a battery .

`` DEWALT DCK285C2 20-Volt MAX Li-Ion Compact 1.5 Ah Hammer Drill and Impact Combo Kit '' This is the best combo kit ever made . Both drill and driver are extremely powerful and lightweight . Batteries last a long time and also charge very quickly .

I 've owned and used a few brands of drills before but Dewalt always has a reputation for toughness above the rest . I actually wanted the full size version but got this one instead . The drill does wobble as mentioned by other reviewers , but it has yet to cause a problem so I do n't think it really concerns me all that much . The compact size is actually pretty nice to get into those tight places and the batteries have yet to die on me while working on jobs around the house.This combo is 3x as much as a Craftsman 19.2 , or other brands I am sure but it comes with a warranty that is 3x longer as well ; and it really has the ergonomics and solid build construction that I am hoping and almost doubting that I will ever have to use said warranty .

I got this Drill set for my husband , while I have not used it myself , he has said he really likes it ( I have since used the drill for a garden project and had no problem using it , it 's not just for men even though it 's best to let them think so ! ) Technical Details* DCD785 20V MAX 1/2-inch hammer drill features two speed transmission ( 0-600 / 0-2,000 ) * Heavy-duty 1/2-inch metal ratcheting chuck provides superior bit gripping strength* DCF885 Impact Driver has a compact ( 5.55-inch front to back ) , lightweight ( 2.8-pounds ) design fits into tight areas* Three ( 3 ) LED lights with 20 second delay after trigger release , provide visibility without shadows* Powered by and Energy Star qualified charger for a better environmentMy husband says : The drill is light-weight , cordless , has a lot of power , compact , and the chuck is easy to use . The drill set also has a clip so you can attach it to your belt . The drill also takes a charge well . I have also held this drill and it is quite comfortable , something that I believe would be quite easy and comfortable for a woman to use.The impact driver works well also , it is also light-weight , easy to use and has a lot of power.This drill is great for the average home-owner and the battery lasts for quite a long time which is a big plus . Not sure if this is normal or a defect but the drill makes a strange sound while on the second speed , this is why I am giving it a 4 star instead of a 5 star ... it is a type of a ratcheting sound which my husband has not encountered before with any of his drills.I received this drill set in exchange for review from the Amazon Vine program .

This is a very nice tool kit . I think this would be a perfect gift for a housing warming present or a gift for a new homeowner . Maybe even a gift for yourself if the occasion is right . Both the hammer drill and the impact drill have proven themselves to me to be very useful around the house . My old drill is a Milwaukee drill that has a cord . I love the power that my old drill gave me , but man is it nice to not have to run electrical cords everywhere when I have a small job to do around the house . This Dewalt drill that runs on 20v does not feel as powerful as my Milwaukee , but I really have not missed that additional power . I also am very impressed with the battery life of the 20v . These drills can really go along time on one charge.Also this is a small that but has brought me a lot of pleasure recently , is just how nice the radio is . The speakers seem to have a good sound to them . The interface is digital . I really enjoy having this little radio ! I like how the radio can also either be plugged in , or it can run off the same 20v . Another reviewer complained about if only she could have one more battery . I understand exactly what she was talking about as it would be nice to have all three of these hooked up and ready to go . As of now , I keep one battery on the hammer drill , I use it a lot more , and one battery plugged in . The other radio is plugged into the outlet in the shed.Because I am a novice DIY I can not speak to the wobble as other reviewers mentioned within their posts . I have not had any problems with the drill so far and have found it to be an enjoyable tool in the face of any challenge .

Both the drill and the impact driver pack a lot of punch and power in comparison to my 18V Dewalt drill . Multiple speeds , impact , you name it . After a couple of days of ownership , I & # 8217 ; m not sure what else I can do to really test this unit : - Repetitive drilling and screws replacing a portion of a wooden fence ? Check- Drilling through concrete ? Check- Drilling through masonry ? CheckI only drilled through the concrete just to see if it could do it & # 8230 ; .now I & # 8217 ; m inspired to tackle a couple of new projects because I now have tolls with the right & # 8220 ; oomph & # 8221 ; to get it done.The battery packs ( the kit comes with two 20V batteries ) hold a heck of a lot of power & # 8211 ; I & # 8217 ; m not sure how long they would really last as after four hours of steady use each day there was still a lot of power left in the frills ; I put them back on the charger at the end of the day as I wanted a full load when I started again the next day.The radio has okay reception and sound & # 8211 ; you can also plug it into a wall instead of just relying on batteries . One convenience to the radio is you can also power your phone via the USB charger on the side of the radio.Considering you get the two drills and the radio , a charger and two 20V battery packs which if you purchased them individually would cost you a little over $ 625 , this is a pretty good deal at $ 339 for the combo . If you are a do-it-yourself & # 8217 ; er or a contractor that travels around , I would recommend thi skit .

I acquired this drill for me -- myself -- a woman . I 've purchased a drill in the past but it was a run-of-the-mill device with no bells and whistles , I do n't even know the brand . It 's so interesting how a shiny new piece of equipment makes you want to walk around the house finding things to do ! I appreciate the fact that it 's so light . My first project was to purchase a special bit for glass and drill holes at the bottom of some beautiful ceramic vases ( for drainage ) . It worked like a dream . I do n't know that I 'll use the radio much because where I live the music choices are either 'country ' or 'western ' , but I imagine it 's just fine for most . I think this is the last drill I 'll ever have .
This is the perfect drill and driver combo for small and medium jobs . The price was better than the big box stores .

This set comes in a quality , durable bag as well as with two batteries . The batteries seemed to charge in under 30 minutes which is amazing . Putting the batteries in the charge and in the devices felt intuitive and simple . Performance of the drill and the driver were above expectation although I am still testing . I also want to test for the wobbling problem that others have reported . I also want to see how long the battery lasts . Also , I loved the LED light ( s ) on the drill/driver that automatically turn on/off.Radio is rugged in all aspects . I 'm very happy that it includes USB and AUX for those with portable MP3 players or smart phones . There is even a clever compartment on the side where you can store your portable music player . The last thing you need is your MP3 player loosely sitting around at a job site . Volume and audio clarity seemed good for the size of it.Only real complain I have thus far is the horrible industrial odor that these guys emit when you first run them . I 'm hoping the smell dissipates over time .

I bought this set from the warehouse deals section of amazon for a substantially lower price . I highly recommend warehouse deals and use it all the time . You can save some serious dough that way . Item was brand new and absolutely perfect in every way . Upon opening and messing with them , I immediately removed the belt clips from them , as I do n't use them and feel they get in the way , your opinion may differ , just a personal preference . The first thing that you will marvel at is just how lightweight these really are . I really bought these on a whim , but had been wanting them for a while . I already own a handful of 18v Dewalt tools with the xrp battery system , which I know I love and use a bunch . I knew I wanted to transition to the lithium ion system but did n't want to retrofit my 18v nicads with li ion batteries with a substantial cost.I also know that I love li ion batteries having already owned Milwaukee 's m12 system and could n't be happier . Those batteries make these tools a complete force to be reckoned . These new tools are now the closest things to being like their corded brethren . You get the amazing power , rpms and torque of corded , with these amazing batteries that are like having a cord because they last all day . I 'm sure that the fatter batteries are even better but only heavier . These will last all day for whatever you are doing and if you do need to recharge , it only takes 30 minutes to charge from dead . The charger also will charge Dewalt 's 12v li ion batteries as well , which I do not have.The hammerdrill will absolutely twist your wrist depending on your bit , which means it has amazing power and torque . But by far the impact driver is my absolute favorite by far . I use it 90 % of the time without hesitation . It 's weight is n't much more than my m12 impact driver which is great . This 20v system is absolutely great and now they are finally offering bare tools as well , also a plus . This is my third impact driver having already the m12 impact , and a dewalt 18v impact . I would not trade these tools for anything and you would have to pry them from my hands . Nothing but good things to say . The only thing that irritates me is that these batteries nor tools have a battery gauge . Maybe I 'm just spoiled by the m12 but that is something I wish these had . Do yourself a favor and try to pick one of these up in warehouse deals . I give my complete recommendation . Thanks for reading , and please vote as to the helpfulness of this review , Ray .

First I would like to mention that I ordered these for domestic use . So this review comes from a guy who needed the tools to the occasional work at home . For my needs , I have to say this set is just what I needed . For years I had been borrowing my father in law 's hammer drill and always liked the fact that it ran on batteries and was cordless , so when I saw this DEWALT I did not hesitate to get it.Upon receiving it , the box was quite larger than I expected , out of the box , the hammer drill and the driver come in heir own carrying bag , the bag was quite light considering it contained both tools and the required charger and batteries . The radio comes in a separate box , opposite to the tools , it is quite heavy , it looks well built , sturdy and I have no doubts the thing is resistant to heavy use . The radio also surprised me because the one thing I was not expecting is that it actually includes USB and AUX inputs , so say you are in the mood of listening to something on your mp3 player on phone , you can actually do that . Not only that , but there is a small compartment built in where you can actually keep your iPod safe inside so you can carry the radio around ( a small AUX cable is included ) . The radio can be plugged to an electrical outlet and it also runs on the same batteries used by the hammer drill and driver ( the batteries are shared actually ) I had some pending work at home ( some shelves and souvenirs that needed to be hung on walls ) so I took that as an opportunity to test the new tools . I was amazed by the hammer drills ' performance after drilling on concrete on several occasions , this is indeed a powerful tool.For my needs , I can honestly say I got more than I expected . I can not see myself not recommending these , they are powerful-quality tools and the price of the set beats the price of getting them separately . Recommended .

This might be the best Father 's Day gift to myself ever . I am not the world 's greatest do-it-yourselfer , mainly because I have never tried or had the right tools . I needed this DeWalt tool set to get me motivated . Both tools have a lot of heft and feel solid in my hands . I used the driver tool to change a number of outdoor lights and it had way more power than I needed for this simple job . Then I used it to assemble a log bed frame . It was much better suited for that heavier job . The radio sounds surprisingly clear and has a good tone . I will be able to use the radio at the pool this summer . I could n't be happier with this tool set . I plan on getting a lot of work around the house accomplished now that I have such great tools . Highly recommended .

This is a great drill set . It comes with a hammer drill , an impact driver , and 2 batteries . The drills and batteries are light but powerful.The batteries where charged within an hour or so , and they last well over an hour each.Both the hammer drill an impact driver are comfortable to hold and deliver a lot of power.My favorite feature is the lights . It makes it really easy to see exactly where you are placing the tip . This is great because I am often casting shadows on to the areas I am working . The lights do n't waste power because they come on when you need them and then shut off on their own.I really find the drills surprisingly powerful . You just do n't get that picture in your head when you think of something battery operated.I highly recommend this set for home projects as well as the professional builder .

These tools are great . The drill is powerful enough to burn out 6 & # 34 ; wall penetrations but also had a hammer feature for concrete or masonry . The impact driver is my go to . Whether I am hanging stuff on the wall or trying to loosen a large nut on a shaft , it is absolutely a perfect tool . Do yourself a favor and get the adapters to use this thing on sockets , it will change your life .

After my 12 volt Black & Decker drill began running out of juice , I decided I needed a new toy ... ummm , I meant `` productivity enhancing equipment '' ( if my wife is reading this ) to help me get through my projects . Because my main reason for purchasing was power running out in the middle of a project , I decided I wanted all the juice I could get , so I opted for the 3.0 Ah battery instead of the of the 1.5 Ah . Sure it adds a LITTLE size and weight , but I think its worth it to have the extra juice . Decided to try the combo , and its nice to not have to keep changing from drill bit to driver bit . Lights at the front are a great bonus as well . Neighbor also decided to buy one when he saw mine .

I 've worked in construction and Hollywood film production for the last twenty years . I 've used and abused every brand of power tool there is . If you want the best cordless tools currently available on Earth , buy this DeWalt 20v kit.These are not tools for the weak , timid , or poor . These are powerful , top-dollar , high-quality professional pieces . If you have any doubt about your need for these tools or your ability to handle them , then please buy something lesser , which is to say , most anything else.You can hurt yourself in a hurry with these tools . The torque from either drill or impact is substantial ; when you hit the trigger , the tool jumps , hard . When you let off the trigger , it stops _right now_ and bucks again . You smell ozone and see sparks . This is good . This is power.These are the first cordless tools I 've ever owned that have not left me wishing for more power . Actually , I 've had to learn respect for these little monsters . The word `` weak '' will never enter your mind when these are around , and you can easily break things and cause all sorts of damage if you 're not careful ; snap bolts , drive screws right through your workpiece ... Much like a powerful car , these reward skill and punish error . You could probably break your wrist with the drill and a big wood bit , if you tried . But I like power and I do n't mind danger . If you feel differently , maybe get something tamer.The chucks are great . The drill 's keyless chuck is strong , positive , industrial , precise . I like how the shaft locks up so you can change bits without hitting the trigger , if you want.The impact driver chuck is excellent , requiring no fiddling to insert , and never jamming up on release like some other impacts I 've dealt with . I guess DeWalt has a new impact with a different pushbutton chuckless setup ; might check that out someday , but this one rocks for now.The battery life is so good , it 's unbelievable . The charger is very quick and has a large LED to let you know what 's up . Speaking of LED 's , the impact has three and the drill has one , all very bright and helpful.I guess some guys do n't like the bag . I 'm happier with a bag than a hard case any day , but that 's personal preference . Anyway , the bag looks built to last and holds the two guns , batteries , and charger comfortably with room for a bit more.The only drawback to these tools is price . They are more expensive than some others , but you get what you pay for in this case at least . For me , the awesome performance plus the anticipated longevity make these tools a great value . Plus , when you show up at a job everyone will be envious and asking to fondle or borrow them . Fondle yes , borrow , no ! I do n't know how they did it , but the box showed up almost before I got done ordering it . Beyond fast shipping.Highly and unconditionally recommended .

Now this is the best of all Dewalt cordless drills . Tough bag this set is a work horse.Easier to drill and put screws in all forms . No need for me to carry extension cords to other sights just for installing 2-4 lights . This tool is a must for you home enthusiats involved in do it yourself projects . Also electricians , carpenters , masons , mechanics , joiners and more . Purchase now to get your job done faster than you ever imagined . If you do n't then you miss out .

I realize there are cheaper sets , also by DeWalt , but I 'm quite happy with this one . Plenty of power , very nice design , good balance . I especially like the lights . A few quibbles : no clutch adjustment on the driver . And the head on the drill is a little large for use in tight spaces . But they fit my hands and I 'm happy to use them every time .

My husband is a remodeling contractor and often an excellent test of how 'sturdy ' a product is . He uses these tools daily , six days a week . The conclusion : DeWalt tools are DURABLE and an absolute must in the contracting field . The cordless , rechargeable battery gives you more options out in the field where the electric may not be hooked up yet . When charged in the morning , the tools last him all day while on the job . The hammerdrill was excellent for going through concrete . There is also a lot to be said for the compact , lightweight size . When you have a truck full of tools and often very little space , you appreciate the ease of these smaller sized drills that do a big job . The lighter weight and easy to carry bag also made it easy for me to bring the tools into the house if I needed them for a lighter job , such as putting in a screw for a picture frame or putting up curtain rods . The perfect gift for the guy or gal who have very little space and need tough tools that can help with numerous projects around the house . I also highly recommend it for college students who find they need to install beds , shelves , bookcases , etc . in their dorm rooms when they first move in . They 're easy to use and not heavy , making them perfect for a younger guy or gal who may not have much experience with drills . The batteries charge quickly and easily , as well as taking up very little storage space .

Before buying this kit I was in doubt about buying both a hammerdrill/driver and an impact driver . But I searched the web to fully understand the difference between the two of them.It turns out that an impact driver is way lighter than the hammerdrill and the torque is way stronger.The 20V batteries last longer than regular 12V batteries and these tools are much more powerfull than other cordless tools I 've tried.The work leds are really helpfull when drilling or fastening on dark , hard to reach places.I 'm a DIY beginner but I already used these tools and they perform great . I also work manufacturing large power supplies and the impact driver is very usefull to assemble all the parts of the power supply together.Pros : Long battery life , really shinny leds , extremely comfortable grip and power to perform almost any task . Fast charge of battery pack.Cons : The hammerdrill DCD985 is really heavy . It weights more without the battery pack than DCF885 with the battery pack.I 've just tried my new tools to fix the curtains of the living room . Despite being heavier than I expected , the DCD985 performs really well . I drilled 4 holes on masonry , using the hammerdrill at minimum rpm ( 0-500 ) . The holes were just perfect . You can see the difference between this drill and other regular power drills . I have a Black & Decker ; corded power hammerdrill but it 's almost impossible to use the hammerdrill at low rpm ratings . And of course , because of the high RPMs , the drill bit almost always slips a little from the original designed drilling markings . It just does n't happen with the DCD985 . You can be sure to start and to finish the drilling process at the very same spot ! ! Amazing ! ! As for the DCF885 , it performs really fine , with the exception of fastening screws on fragile working pieces . I just destroyed the curtain wooden holding hooks with this impact driver . Now I know that it was a job for a regular driver ( without impact aid ) . The impact driver is more suitable to fastening large bolts and performing heavy-duty kind of work .

I 've never treated myself to a power tool this expensive , but it worth every penny . It is a joy to use and a beautiful piece of craftsmanship in itself . Previously , whenever the going got tough - drilling into brick etc - I had to put my cordless drill aside an drag out an old 1/2 horsepower corded drill . No need any longer -- the DeWalt can handle anything . I have a whole workroom full of tools , including two other drills -- but if I had to choose between the DeWalt and everything else , I 'd take the DeWalt !

I bought this set because I was having problems finding 18V Li-Ion compact batteries locally.I like the power of the drills and the impact driver is the bomb ! ! ! ! I 'm still not too sure about the carry bag though ...

this is the big boy kit with the hammer drill and the bigger batteries . i bought this because my porter cable batteries were starting to suck . it takes a long time to get through one of these 3.0ah batteries..I love it . it 's real nice having two sets of impacts also . Both drills have nice lights , the impact is so nice and small and powerful with a belt clip ! you can just pop the 1/4 inch shank in without pulling the little circular thing out like on other impacts . the hammer drill is pretty large and heavy , but it 's a hammer drill and pretty powerful for being cordless

I can not believe I did not purchase this combo set MUCH earlier . After doing much research online , I determined that the dewalt 20v max set was right for me , and since it includes ( 2 ) 3.0ah batteries , the set could not be any more complete . I have had the opportunity to test out both drills and can not be pleased enough . The hammer drill has A LOT of power and is VERY compact in comparison to other Dewalt hammer drill models I 've owned in the past . Both drills have AWESOME weight distribution for a balanced feel . The led light on the hammer drill and the 3 led lights on the impact drill are a great extra when getting a better view at the area being worked in . The impact drill is very compact and packs quite a punch . Ive tested it out with wood screws , tap cons , long bits , short bits , etc . It does it all . The hammer drill has various settings that can be altered according to the type of task being put through . Overall , I AM VERY pleased with this set . Dewalt has n't failed me yet , so I 'll continue buying their products . Aside from the fact that the drills both work incredibly well , are compact , well balanced , and well designed , they are also aesthetically VERY nice looking and the matching contractors bag completes the set . I HIGHLY recommend this set . The $ 299 is worth EVERY PENNY .

In my opinion , the best combo . If you 're not familiar with DEWALT , you will not regret this purchase . Well made power tools , very solid build , feel great in your hand , not too heavy or too light , enough power for whatever you need . It will hurt when you drop them but they can take the abuse . The battery last almost forever , easy to tell when it 's charged since it has a button led display of the charge level . The duffle bag is nice and well made but I do n't use it other than storage ( I 'm organized ) .

This DeWalt 20v drill / impact driver kit is very high quality , is well made , and the 3.0 ah , 60w batteries last a long time . I often use my drill all day doing commercial HVAC work so the higher capacity batteries were a must , but the extra expense ( over the 1.5 ah ) may be wasted if you only use the tool occasionally . I also own a red M18 XC combo kit ( 47w ) and an orange 18v NiCd combo kit and the DeWalt is the only one with a three speed selector , and the batteries are easier to remove . The Li ion batteries are very expensive for this tool if purchased separately , so hopefully I can get at least two years out of them . I do not have long-term usage info yet but it seems like it 's a heavy duty drill.The tools are of equal or better quality than the others I have owned and used and it looks like the soft rubber parts of the drill housing are heavier and will hold up better than some of the other brands have . I also bought the LED flashlight for the 20v system and it 's nice and compact to fit in the bag . I really like the one hand chuck on the impact driver which makes it easy to change tools on the fly.Unfortunately you get a canvas bag instead of a hard case , but it 's decent quality . I put my sockets and hex chucks and bit tips in a small zipper bag that fits nicely in the tool bag with the drill and driver and charger . I recommend removing the batteries from the tools when in storage and transit .

I have had this for a few months now and its a huge improvement over my last drill / Driver which was a Dewalt 14.4 VUpdateBattery LifeThe battery life of this drill is huge . I have the 3 A hour battery and I hardly ever need to charge it . I just moved and I have done a lot of little project . So far since owning these I have charged each battery two times at most . This was not the case with my older 14.4 V drill . I would have had 10 or more charges at this point.Batteries also charge very quickly , feels like 30 minutes at most for a full charge.Old ReviewI have previously used and still own a Dewalt 14.4 volt drill and driver so I am aware of what the tools are capable of . I have had the 14.4 volt drill for 13+ years and it still works great , but the two batteries it came with are shot . The driver for 4 years also still works well and has good batteries . I decided on the upgrade because I wanted to give myself a Christmas gift , and a new battery was already $ 60.I went for the impact combo because based on reviews it seemed to have better features and I already had a non-impact drill . I also went with the 3.0A hours as it was not much extra money.The two features I want to talk about are weight and the wobbleWobbleIf you read reviews and watch videos of this drill there are a lot of complaints about bit wobble . Mine has no wobble at all , even on impact mode . If wobble is an issue it must be on an older or different model.Weight / size.This thing is super light . The batteries are much lighter and smaller then my 14.4 V. I originally got the 14.4 13 years ago because at the time 18V batteries were huge . Overall each tool is a little less in size and weight as the 14.4 weight models . I did not expect this.ConsThe only con so far is only the impact driver came with the belt clip . I did not even know that was part of the package when I bought it and I was like , `` wow this belt clip is super cool '' but then when it was not on the drill I was somewhat bummed . So its just a 1/2 bonus .

The order came as expected . The tools are built well . I charged the batteries and have been useing them for over a week and have not charged them since . I have alway been a fan of DeWalt tools and have used them for many years . I think this combo is one of the finest from DeWalt . Just wish extra batteries were not so expensive .

After mostly having simple B & D drills around the house for repairs this beautiful set came along as an eyeopener of sorts.First and foremost its awesome looking.Has reasonable weight.Not too heavy ..not too light.Rechargeable with 20V lithium ion batteries.Sports 3 LED lights which makes the need for headlamps etc a thing of the past.Easy torque adjustments.Well designed storage bag to keep everything and more in place.The hammer drill is what get much use in my house and its awesome how easy and fast it makes of what would otherwise be hard work.This is super powerful inspite of rechargeable batteries definitely a must for people into home repairs.Seemed like and overkill at first for home repairs to me but it makes perfect sense to have 1 solid peice of equipment for good than replacing the cheap ones every few years.Definitely a great set to own for anyone who owns a house .

I am an occasional fixer upper , so this is definitely more than what I need . But the best review is from two friends who have borrowed these drills and afterwards purchased at least one of them for their own use.Most homeowners at sometime purchased a power drill . For the casual person , like me , this is probably enough . But for those who do DIY projects on a regular basis , the little extra power will probably pay big dividends and make the projects go faster.Having two batteries is great because they are interchangable . So if one runs out you can use the other and charge the first .

I recently sold myDeWalt DCD780C2 20-Volt Max Li-Ion Compact 1.5 Ah Drill/Driver Kitand my hammer drill ... to upgrade ! It does n't make sense sometimes to buy tools separately when the kits are so much cheaper ! Factor in the cost of batteries , and well , you save enough to justify.Tools work as expected . Nothing unexpected . I was a little disappointed at not having a hard case , but this soft case is n't made like the cheap ones I 'm used to . It actually feels durable and looks to have enough space to hold the kit contents ( ca n't say that for every kit bag ) .What 's annoying though is that only one belt clip is included , and NO bit holders included like on the compact drill I sold ( part # N098881 ) . And these things are n't easy to find , so far , I have n't had any luck locating them for sale separately , and Dewalt customer support simply shrugged me off . ( On their website it says the bit holder has been substituted by the belt clip [ ... ] ) Obviously not a make or break thing , as hanging the hammer drill from my belt would likely depants me . But I still use the clips to hang the tools up or off to the side . Good tools , but come on ! You can find the clip here : DeWalt Belt Clip/Hook for 20V Max Drill/Hammerdrill/Driver DCD980 DCD985 DCD980L2 DCD985L2

I read the reviews and saw a few people say there was wobble in the drill . Bought one end of 2013 for Christmas and either they have changed the chuck or I got one that does n't wobble - either way was willing to risk the wobble due to Amazon 's excellent return policy which in this case I did not need to use ! I 've used both the drill and driver for quite a few home hobby projects over the last few weeks and am loving the inbuilt light feature . My trusty 'orange ' 12v drill has n't had any use lately and looks like it is destined for being given away.The 20v power these drills provides means I have n't had to bust out my corded drill lately , so may be saying good bye to that as well ! All in all , best drill purchase I have ever made in my entire life . Highly recommended .

The impact driver is a gem . Used my brothers and had to have it . The drill is very handy as well and a clear upgrade from my old 9 volt Makita system ( which served me well for years and years ) . I would give 5 stars if it had a hard case like DeWalt use to do for these power hand tools . The soft case is worthless for these tools as they can not be organized and stored securely . On the other hand , if you need a little satchel for something else , I guess it works for that .

My wife surprised me with this for me as a gift , I had grown awful tired of having to charge my Ryobi before I used it and having had an XRP that grew legs , I had nudged that I wanted the new 20v max set . This is the first impact driver that I have ever had and only the 2nd I 've used , my father in law has a new Milwaukee , but the DCF885 is an animal . I used it for tearing apart my snow blower and it broke free every bolt I put it on . It 's really nice to actully drive 3 & # 34 ; screws without striping the heads out . The battery life is great , I mean , I 'm not a full time contractor , but I used it nearly every day for a week when I got it with out charging . The drill in this set is the DCD985 , I probably wo n't be need the hammer function for a while , but the drill performs very well . Plenty of power for 1 & # 34 ; spade bits , enough finesse to use as a screwdriver putting furniture together etc . Again , great batter life , awesome chuck . The only three complaints with this set are the bag could be a little bit bigger , the chuck on the impact has a minor wobble with longer drill bits , and the drill seems to throw sparks the first few times I use it but now that it broke in its fine . All around a good set , I 'm very happy with it , I bought the flash light to go with it and I 'm going to buy the circular saw as well . Dewalt did a great job with these new tools and this set will last me a long time
purchased to replace same set in 18v xr , lithium ion batteries proved superior in staying power . still will keep 18v asbackup or for helpers on the construction sight .

For my kids birthday we bought a swingset/clubhouse that required HOURS of assembly . My step father brought his DEWALT and everyone who helped put the set together wants one now . My personal drill used up both batteries in the first hour and it takes all night to charge . This DEWALT literally takes 30 minutes to charge . That alone is worth it ! On top of that the drills are very powerful . So much so that you have to be careful . When switching from my weak lame drill to this one I 'd forget the power behind it and pull the trigger hard . If your in a tight area with your knuckles close to something the whiplash will get you . We were amazed at the strength and speed of the units.I really liked the feel of the hammer drill . It is very small but packs a punch . I 've never used a hammer drill before so I was surprised at how well it get tight bolts in.Throughout the whole process my dad , my brother in law , and myself kept saying man I want one of these . So now I 'm price checking !

I was very surprised and happy to have bought these drills for the price it was offered . It would 've been 6 out of 5 stars ( I know it 's not possible ) if the case was hard , and not soft.I found these to be of better overall feel in your hand than the Milwaukee counter parts -- but I still think Milwaukee tools look better , and the easier battery change . : PThere is more than enough torque and power for any job I 've had to do so far . But I almost feel like having 3 speed settings with the 20+ clutch positions is almost overkill . I usually stick with the 2nd or 3rd gear and if i need it to drill slower , I just squeeze less on the trigger . That 's just my opinion.Definitely recommended . If you are looking at the combos with impact and just drill and not hammer drill , do n't . Pay the extra few bucks for the hammer option . It 's such a devastating feeling when you need to drill through masonry and you ca n't , but you try anyways and dull out your drill bits . : (

I have n't really used the impact driver much yet , but I 'm loving the hammer drill . The battery lasts a long time and it does the job well . I 'm not going to remove a star for the case because that is n't the product being sold here , besides that , I am using one one of the tough system cases for my drill .

I rated this 5 stars because these two tools are BEASTS ! The kit comes with a Hammer Drill and a Reciprocating Saw . Both of these tools work great ! I 've had many DeWalt tools over the years and these live up to the same expectations of all the others . This particular kit comes with 2 3.0 Ah batteries that last a really long time . The bag for the tools is great and big enough to add the other DeWalt tools I purchased separately .

Note : I believe that only two piece combo kits for the 20V version come with the 'retail ' version of the saw . The rec saw included in the 5 piece kit has a different model number than the one they sell by itself . The two piece kits have the same model as the one you buy by itself . There 's a difference . I 'm not going through that in my review as you can just as well Google it since now you know it 's there.Rec . Saw : I 've used this on several projects . It works as advertised . The battery has lasted me much longer than the 18V dewalt . But that could be due to age of the batteries . I like the quick release on the side and i like the fact that i can put a blade in facing any way i need it . The saw feels solid in hands and the grips keep it there.Hammer Drill : I 've used this for plenty of drilling and driving . It surely has the power and the detachable metal handle comes in handy in some situation . However , as a hammer drill it is just ok . I was able to drill through brick rather easily . However , when i needed to drill through cinder-blocks it took a lot more effort on my part than i liked . It does it 's job just fine - but keep in mind that this DOES NOT replace an SDS drill . Not a downfall of this drill - so i 'm not taking a star off . This drill was designed to do some hammer drilling ( and it does , better through some materials than others ) . If your primary use is drilling into cinder blocks though - i 'd consider a supplement they 're not that expensive . Check reviews on Amazon , I 'm sure you 'll find one you like.Overall i 'm satisfied with this tool combo . Since this purchase , i also bought the Dewalt 20v jigsaw and flashlight to complement the set.The charger is nice and quick , but somehow feels a little cheaper than the previous Dewalt chargers.The new battery connector - not too crazy about it . But it seems a lot of other people like it just fine . I thin the idea is good , but the connector is not refined enough .

I 'm a single woman who has to take care of a house by herself , so I need a drill with power . I also occasionally build small things , living on a mini-farm.I love the slimmer handle grip on this DeWalt drill..My last drill was a Makita and I 'm a petite woman and my hand had to stretch too much to reach around the grip ... This drill 's grip is much slimmer and I 'm so very happy about that . The weight is good and balanced , although it 's a pound more than my Makita.The BEST part is how the battery attaches to the drill ! ! I struggled so much getting my Makita battery on and off because my hands are so small , but this one you just click it on and then simply push a button to remove it..I ca n't tell you how much better that is for me . Thank you DeWalt ! The instructions are clear and are accordion style . However I did not understand the charger symbols..Simply the light blinks when it 's charging and solid when it 's fully charged . The rest of the buttons on the drill are simple and easy to understand . Even with the confusing instructions about the symbols , charging is simple and it takes about one hour to charge one battery.The box includes a very durable tote bag with extra side pockets on the outside and inside . No compartments inside to separate the drill by itself though..but at least I can keep drill , charging units and battery all in one place.The saw was a bonus for me..because I have a jigsaw I mainly use for most everything , but I may learn to use it now that I have one.For anyone who does n't know ... a Hammerdrill is used to drill into concrete , bricks etc . It hammers as it drills to be able to do this . I think that option will offer up a lot more ways to use this drill , being able to drill into bricks and through concrete .

Super sweet drill sawzaw combo , the only thing is when really really using the sawzaw it seems to fall on it 's face and slow down here and there , i am not sure if it is a overheat circuit in the motor protecting it or what

The drill was great but kept slipping when I tried to use it to put in screws . Would not hold and drive them in all the way . I know this is not the normal for this drill since I also have another that does great . Too bad since I wanted this with the reciprocal saw match .

If you are a new homeowner , this is the drill to get . I have used it to drill through wood , plastic , steel ductwork , and brick , having no problems . Just make sure that you use the correct bit for the job.I decided to get the kit with the reciprocating saw , as it was not much more expensive than the drill alone.If you are comparing the kit to other dewalt kits , pay extra attention to the reciprocating saw . There are two different saws in the 20V Max line , and this is the nicer of the two . The other saw does not have the 4-position blade clamp or the adjustable shoe.The bag is a tough bag , but does not securley hold the tools . They just lay loose . I would expect to at least have a couple of straps , or dedicated pockets . Not too big of a deal , as the tools are the real meat of this kit , but I would expect a little better in a $ 400 kit .

Lately myDEWALT DC988KA 18-Volt Cordless Hammerdrill/Drill/Driver Kithas been dying and not holding a charge for more than 30 minutes with minimal effort drilling . Then the quest began in search of a new one . So many choices , so many choices . First I thought to myself , why not just buy new batteries ? Well again so many options , Ni-Cad vs Li-Ion what was the difference besides price vs function . TheDeWalt DC9180-2-C ( 2 ) 18V NANO Lithium-Ion Batteries w/ DC9310 7.2V - 18V Ni-Cd / Ni-MH / NANO Lithium-Ion 1-Hour Battery ChargerAlmost $ 200 for 2 batteries and a charger equates to around $ 100.00 a battery in almost any big box store , NOT ON MY WATCH ! . But why compromise when you can have both , so I went with the newDEWALT DCK292L2 20-Volt MAX Li-Ion 3.0 Ah Hammer Drill and Reciprocating Saw Combo Kitand a freeDEWALT DCB200 20-Volt MAX Li-Ion 3.0 Ah Battery Packwith an additional $ 25.00 off . For $ 300.00 I received 3 new 3.0 Ah batteries with a new premium hammerdrill and the good quality sawzaw as free bonus 's . Do n't be fooled into getting theDEWALT DCK490L2 20-Volt MAX Li-Ion 3.0 Ah 4-Tool Combo KitorDEWALT DCK590L2 20-Volt MAX Li-Ion 3.0 Ah 5-Tool Combo Kitand think you are getting a quality sawzaw or circular saw . Look at the DEWALT website and compare the numbers on the saws they are cheaper and do not have as many options . I also orderdDEWALT DCB201-2 20-Volt MAX Li-Ion 1.5 Ah Compact Battery 2-Packfor $ 100.00 with $ 25.00 off and PRIME two day shipping . All in total 5 batteries two premium tools for $ 375.00 and a charger . Now back to the review with comparrison to the old XRPPros:30 minute chargerbatteries are 25 % cheaperlast 25 % longerLi-Ion batteriesBalance is unbelieveable naturalNot as heavy as old XRPBest price I can find anywhereBuilt my outdoor deck on 1 battery , drilled 20 1/2 '' x6 '' and 100 1/4 '' x4 '' spax screws/lag bolts and over 200 # 10 2-7/8 '' structural screws in 2x4 , 2x6 , 2x12 , 4x4 in the course of one day.2 day shipping90 day satisfaction return policy2 year limited warrantyWhat else can I say , I am a DEWALT kinda guy and a horrible spellar.I also left the drill in my car overnight for a test -5 degrees outside , still had a full charge on it.I bought the 12v max drill/driver combo as well and it makes an excellent addition to this 20v set.On DEWLAT 's website they note in the future this line of tools will eb expanded to meet the old 18v tool line . Like the grinder , jigsaw , and a few others . This is the time to start purchasing as they are pushing th elower prices to launch the new 20v line . Also this is actualy 18v it jsut distinguishes a slide on battery vs the old goos neck type . It is all a marketing scheme btu it works !

It 's taken me a little while to test out all the tools . Overall , I 'm very happy with the set , and think it 's a reasonable price . For more money , you can get more powerful tools , but these are great for someone like me , who does relatively regular home projects , but not major repair.What I liked about the 1/4 impact driver : Super compact and fits into small spaces like a joist or cabinet . I sometimes get tired of holding my heavy driver when I 'm working with my arms above my head ; this was much lighter and easier to maneuver . I was impressed with the amount of torque . I 'd give it 4 stars , as it only seems to hold 1 '' bits . Sometimes I need a different size , but I do have my other driver.The reciprocating saw is small enough that I was finally able to make a ceiling joist cut to fix a door opening problem . ( I installed a screen door on the outside ; the joist for the ceiling overhang is in the way ) . As the battery wore down , though , the cuts were n't quite as smooth . 3.5 stars.The LED is very bright and long-lasting . I can use it camping and also when the power goes out ; it 's nice to have something with a rechargable battery , as it 's likely to be charged and ready-to-go . I did not test the entire length it operated , but did have it on constantly for 6 hours with no noticable dimming . It 's very easy to adjust and position ; in addition , it has a little metal clip to hang for hands-free ( although the base is stable enough that it can also stand on a level surface ) . 4.5 stars.The bag is just a regular , standard bag . It 's not of much use if you have an existing bag or regular toolbelt . 3 stars.All of the batteries were fully charged within an hour of their first use ; afterwards , it seems like they are usually fully charged between 30 - 45 minutes .

The reciprocating saw does not have the 4 side positioning blade like the other version only up and down . Other than that it is a great set . Flash light is strong and has a good focus beam of light that goes far enough .

Pretty much have one of each of the 20v Max tools . Long battery life , great durability . Mine get dropped a lot ... .Just one of those tools that I try to balance on the top of a ladder all too often . Loved my 18V system for many years and then switched to these once they went mainstream ... .. Do n't miss those 18v at all . These weight less and put out more ... plus last longer .

I have used the set for several weeks now . It has met all of my expectation . The drill in particular is fantastic , the same heavy duty I have used in the NiCad version . This combo kit is a great deal .

These high quality battery-run tools compare in weight and power to 120 volt tools ... .I took a used swing set apart using the impact driver to break loose several rusted bolts and the the saws to cut bolts that would n't budge ... the batteries charge fast and are very light compared to older 12 or 14 volt batteries . The storage bag is a heavy grade fabric is large enough to hold the tools and charger nicely .

One of my great annoyances with rechargeable products has been battery life . Charge it up hoping to have it ready for use at any time and inevitably by the time you actually need it , the battery is dead and you wind up waiting hours for it to charge . The only solution is to constantly monitor the battery and charge as often as needed regardless of use .
